title: 40th Military Airlift Squadron
text:
The 40th Military Airlift Squadron is an inactive <a href="United%20States%20Air%20Force">United States Air Force</a> unit. Its last assignment was to the <a href="438th%20Military%20Airlift%20Wing">438th Military Airlift Wing</a>, <a href="Military%20Airlift%20Command">Military Airlift Command</a>, stationed at <a href="McGuire%20Air%20Force%20Base">McGuire Air Force Base</a>, New Jersey.
It was inactivated on 4 March 1968.
History.
The unit was activated as the 40th Ferrying (later, Transport) Squadron under <a href="Air%20Transport%20Command%20%28United%20States%20Air%20Force%29">Ferrying (later Air Transport) Command</a> at <a href="Canton%20Island%20Airport">Canton Island Airport</a>, <a href="Gilbert%20Islands">Gilbert Islands</a>, in August 1942. It ferried various aircraft, including A-20s, B-17s, B-24s, B-25s, B-26s, P-38s, P-40s, C-46s, and C-47s, to destinations in the Pacific Theater. The squadron also provided a maintenance service for transient aircraft until inactivated on 30 September 1943.
It was reactivated in 1954 under <a href="Military%20Air%20Transport%20Service">Military Air Transport Service</a> at <a href="Dover%20AFB">Dover AFB</a>, Delaware in 1954. The squadron flew very long range <a href="C-124%20Globemaster">C-124 Globemaster</a> intercontinental transport aircraft carrying passengers and cargo, throughout the MATS Atlantic Division, to <a href="Europe">Europe</a>, <a href="Africa">Africa</a> and the <a href="Middle%20East">Middle East</a>.
It was inactivated in 1960.
The squadron was reactivated again in 1962 at <a href="McGuire%20AFB">McGuire AFB</a>, <a href="New%20Jersey">New Jersey</a> and equipped with the <a href="C-135A/B">C-135A/B</a> jet transport. It carried cargo between the US and Vietnam until it was inactivated in 1968 when MAC C-135 operations came to an end.
